5/
Days w/ big downswings in #ETH price tend to have the highest increases in basefees. Our data shows that on the:
- top 20 downswing days‚Äîmedian basefee was 119.8 gwei
- top 20 breakeven days‚Äîmedian basefee was 102 gwei
- top 20 upswing days‚Äîmedian basefee was 101.6 gwei

4/
‚Äã‚ÄãMedian base fees during downswings seems to be consistent w/ the hypothesis that the big downswing days cause larger increases in #ETH gas base fees, perhaps b/c of Collateralized Debt Position liquidations #CDP

3/
This correlation continued throughout most of the rise and fall from the #ETH #ATH last November.

But the correlation took a divergence the past two weeks, moving from a weak positive to a strong negative correlation, evident in the chart below. https://t.co/a5YuAuXV6W

2/
For most of the past five months there has been a positive, albeit weak, correlation between the daily #ETH price and median gas base fee.

This means median gas price and the price of ETH tends to move up/down together, but the relationship isn‚Äôt very strong.

1/
Is there a correlation between #ETH price volatility and gas price? 

Absolutely. But it‚Äôs not that simple‚Ä¶ [thread]

Who is going to be the first to integrate?‚Ä¶

Every #Ethereum builder and trader can go hands-on with the Transaction Preview API today. 

Start now for free by creating an account at https://t.co/hyJKD4kAi3 

Learn more in our detailed API documents: https://t.co/2AOEdBPxe7

üèéÔ∏è

And did we mention Blocknative‚Äôs Transaction Preview is fast?

Preview typically simulates transactions 10x faster than other solutions. 

We expect that this API will help to enable new profit opportunities for traders and new experiences for end-users.
This allows #ethereum traders to accurately assess the effects of a potential trade on any pools impacted, the amount received, slippage experienced, and gas used.

üíπ

Traders can also use Preview to simulate variations of a potential trade using different inputs (gas limit, gas price, and transaction input) and execute the most profitable one.

üë©‚Äçüíª

This composable API will enable new experiences for end-users such as previewing and timing #NFT Mints and seeing whether their transaction will go through or fail WITHOUT having to pay gas.

Web3 Developers can use Preview to accurately inform end-users of:

‚õΩÔ∏è Gas consumption
üí± Slippage
üëõ Updated balances
‚ùå Whether the internal calls/TX itself will execute correctly or fail
‚ö´Ô∏è And more!
Users can modify simulation inputs such as from address, gas limit, gas prices per transaction type, and transaction input to understand how these factors impact their expected balance changes

Blocknative Transaction Preview API is now available on Ethereum Mainnet! 

Wallets, protocols, and traders can now see expected slippage, net-balance changes, and smart contract calls BEFORE signing transactions.

üßµ

RT @Lpapi_speaks: Exploring @blocknative and their products. Check out their gas heat map when strategizing around DEFI and NFTs. 

I am go‚Ä¶

By mastering the mempool, you can have mastery over predictable transaction performance. 

It‚Äôs a critical piece of the puzzle for anyone transacting on blockchain networks. 

https://t.co/xofAN26hKP

Because we see every public pending transaction, we can predict the future contents of upcoming blocks. 

That means that you can now track individual transactions and their various states as it moves through the mempool.  #blockchain #prechain

In this complex, fast-moving, sparse data space, Blocknative makes it easy to work with real-time blockchain transaction data. 

We provide our customers with visibility across everything that‚Äôs happening, not just certain things, but the entire public #mempool.
On-chain transactions are immutable, so once things get written down to the blockchain and go on-chain, you can‚Äôt change them.

And the mempool is the root of transaction risk. Pre-consensus transactions can:
‚ùå get lost
‚ùå get stuck
‚ùå get dropped
‚ùå they can fail

It turns out the mempool is a pretty interesting, different, unexpected information space. It‚Äôs global in nature‚Äìthere‚Äôs no such thing as one mempool or ‚Äúthe mempool.‚Äù There are just tens of thousands of copies; each individual node has its own copy.

The mempool is the root of real-time transactions. If you‚Äôve ever wondered what is going on with your transaction while you‚Äôre waiting for it to confirm, check the mempool. 

#blockchain #cryptocurrency #NFT #ethereum

üìñ First, a definition: 

The mempool is the pre-consensus layer of a public blockchain network. 

You submit a transaction, wait for a while, then hopefully, it gets confirmed. ü§î

Do you want to learn how Blocknative got started and the power of real-time blockchain transaction data? 

Check out @mcutler's recent @securitiesio interview by @futuristdotai. And read on for the tl;dr üßµ

During major NFT launches, you need to monitor the Base Fee and the Priority Fee.

Blocknative is here to help. Our Gas Estimator monitors every publicly pending transaction to estimate fees to get into the next block.

https://t.co/m5ia4EKu2E

Are you noticing a trend here? 

In major #NFT launches the Priority Fee surges first and drives the Base Fee up. The two combine to create a tabletop ‚Äî usually around 2,000 GWEI. 

üí∏
